short_rules: You can invest tiny objects with minor magical effects, like light, recorded messages, or visual symbols, using your tools as a focus.
You learn to cast artificer spells using Intelligence, with a small number of 1st-level spell slots and cantrips.
new_spells_known: Learn several 1st-level artificer spells from the class list.

short_rules: You learn magical infusions that let you turn mundane objects into temporary magic items after a rest.
notes: You know a limited number of infusions and can have only a few items infused at once.

short_rules: You choose a specialization such as alchemist, artillerist, or battle smith, gaining new features and bonus spells.

feature_name: The Right Tool for the Job
short_rules: With your tools and an hour of work, you can conjure the exact artisan's tools you need for the task at hand.
Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 2nd-level artificer spell slots and more total slots.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check that uses a tool you are proficient with.
When you or a nearby creature makes an ability check or saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your Intelligence modifier to the roll a limited number of times per day.
Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 3rd-level artificer spell slots and more total slots.
You can attune to more magic items than usual and craft common or uncommon items faster and cheaper than other characters.
notes: Typically raises your attunement limit by 1 and improves crafting efficiency.

short_rules: You can store a low-level artificer spell in a weapon or focus, allowing it to be cast repeatedly from that item using your spellcasting ability.
notes: Uses your Intelligence and can hold many charges based on your modifier.

short_rules: Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 4th-level artificer spell slots and more total slots.
Your command of magic items deepens: you can attune to more items and ignore many class, race, or level restrictions on using them.
notes: Often lets you attune to an additional magic item and bypass restrictions on item use.

short_rules: You gain the 15th-level feature from your chosen artificer specialization.
Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 5th-level artificer spell slots and more total slots.
You reach peak mastery with magic items, attuning to even more of them at once than most adventurers could dream of.
notes: Raises your maximum number of attuned magic items again.

short_rules: Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your bond with your infused items toughens your body and spirit, boosting your saving throws and letting you sacrifice infusions to cling to life instead of falling in battle.
notes: Capstone that adds bonuses per attuned item and lets you drop to 1 HP instead of 0 by ending an infusion.

short_rules: Enter a battle frenzy a limited number of times per day, gaining bonus damage and resistance to common physical damage while it lasts.
notes: Use the SRD barbarian table for exact rage damage bonus and uses per long rest.

short_rules: While you are not wearing armor, your armor class is 10 plus your Dexterity modifier plus your Constitution modifier.

When you make your first melee attack on your turn using Strength, you can choose to swing recklessly, gaining advantage on those attacks but granting advantage to attacks made against you until your next turn.
You gain an instinct for danger, giving you advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see, such as many traps and spells.
notes: You must not be blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

short_rules: Choose a primal path that shapes your rage; it grants extra features at higher barbarian levels.
notes: Refer to your chosen path for its specific features.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make two weapon attacks instead of just one.
Your walking speed increases while you are not wearing heavy armor.
notes: Use the SRD barbarian table for the amount of the speed bonus.

short_rules: You gain the 6th-level feature from your chosen primal path.
notes: Details depend on your selected path.

short_rules: Your instincts sharpen, granting you advantage on initiative rolls and letting you act normally on your first turn if you rage when surprised.
notes: You must enter a rage before doing anything else on that first turn while surprised.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
Your critical hits with Strength-based melee attacks hit harder; you roll one extra weapon damage die when determining the damage of such a critical.
notes: This adds to the normal extra damage dice for a critical hit.

short_rules: You gain the 10th-level feature from your chosen primal path.
notes: Details depend on your selected path.

short_rules: Your rage keeps you fighting through grievous injuries; when you would drop to 0 hit points while raging, you can make a save to remain at 1 hit point instead.
notes: The difficulty of this save increases each time you use this feature between rests.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
Your Brutal Critical improves; you now roll two extra weapon damage dice when you score a critical hit with a Strength-based melee attack.
notes: Replaces the earlier one-die version.

short_rules: You gain the 14th-level feature from your chosen primal path.
notes: Details depend on your selected path.

short_rules: Your rage is difficult to break; it only ends early if you fall unconscious or choose to stop raging.
notes: You no longer lose rage merely for not attacking or taking damage.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
Your Brutal Critical improves again; you now roll three extra weapon damage dice when you score a critical hit with a Strength-based melee attack.
notes: Replaces the earlier two-dice version.

short_rules: Your raw strength can carry you through impossible feats; if the result of a Strength check is lower than your Strength score, you can use your score as the total instead.
notes: Applies only to Strength ability checks, not attack rolls or saving throws.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
Your Strength and Constitution scores each increase by 4, and their maximum values each increase to 24.
notes: Update your ability modifiers and derived stats accordingly.

short_rules: You cast bard spells using Charisma and know a few cantrips and 1st-level spells.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Gain 1st-level spell slots; see bard spell slot table.
new_spells_known: Start with several 1st-level spells known.
notes: Exact slots and spells known follow the bard spellcasting table.

short_rules: Bonus action to give an ally a d6 inspiration die a limited number of times per long rest.
Add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to ability checks that do not already include it.
During a short rest, creatures who hear your performance regain extra d6 healing when they spend Hit Dice.
Choose a bard college; gain its level 3 feature or features.
Choose two skill proficiencies; your proficiency bonus is doubled for them.
You gain access to 2nd-level spell slots and additional slots overall.
new_spells_known: +1 or more bard spells known.
notes: Use bard spellcasting table for exact numbers.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your Bardic Inspiration dice now refresh on a short rest instead of only on a long rest.
Your Bardic Inspiration die increases to a d8.
You gain access to 3rd-level spell slots and additional slots overall.
new_spells_known: +1 or more bard spells known.

short_rules: You can use your action to grant allies advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed until your next turn.
You gain the 6th-level feature from your bard college.
You gain access to 4th-level spell slots and additional slots overall.
new_spells_known: +1 or more bard spells known.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your Song of Rest extra healing die increases to a d8.
You gain access to 5th-level spell slots and additional slots overall.
new_spells_known: +1 or more bard spells known.

short_rules: Your Bardic Inspiration die increases to a d10.
Choose two more skill proficiencies to gain Expertise with.
Learn two spells from any class list that count as bard spells for you.
new_spells_known: Learn 2 spells from any class list.
notes: Spells must be of a level you can cast.

short_rules: You gain access to 6th-level spell slots and additional slots overall.
new_spells_known: +1 or more bard spells known.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your Song of Rest extra healing die increases to a d10.
You gain access to 7th-level spell slots and additional slots overall.
new_spells_known: +1 or more bard spells known.

short_rules: You gain the 14th-level feature from your bard college.
Learn two more spells from any class list that count as bard spells for you.
new_spells_known: Learn 2 additional off-list spells.

short_rules: Your Bardic Inspiration die increases to a d12.
You gain access to 8th-level spell slots and additional slots overall.
new_spells_known: +1 or more bard spells known.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your Song of Rest extra healing die increases to a d12.
You gain access to 9th-level spell slots and additional slots overall.
new_spells_known: +1 or more bard spells known.

short_rules: Learn two more spells from any class list that count as bard spells for you.
new_spells_known: Learn 2 additional off-list spells.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
When you roll initiative and have no Bardic Inspiration uses left, regain one use.
You cast cleric spells using Wisdom; you know several cantrips and 1st-level spells.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Gain 1st-level spell slots; see cleric spellcasting table.
new_spells_known: Prepare cleric spells each day based on Wisdom and level.
notes: Exact slots and preparation rules follow the cleric spellcasting table.

short_rules: Choose a divine domain; it grants extra spells and features at various levels.
You can channel divine energy to fuel special effects; uses recover on a short or long rest.
As an action, present your holy symbol to force nearby undead to flee on a failed save.
notes: Exact save DC and area follow the cleric Channel Divinity rules.

short_rules: You gain the 2nd-level feature from your divine domain.
notes: The exact feature depends on your chosen domain.

short_rules: You gain access to 2nd-level spell slots and additional spell slots overall.
new_spells_known: Prepare additional spells as your level and Wisdom increase.
notes: See cleric spellcasting table for exact slots.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
When you successfully Turn Undead, undead of challenge rating 1/2 or lower are destroyed instead of turned.
You gain access to 3rd-level spell slots and additional spell slots overall.
new_spells_known: Prepare additional spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: You can use Channel Divinity twice between rests.
You gain the 6th-level feature from your divine domain.
notes: The exact feature depends on your chosen domain.

short_rules: You gain access to 4th-level spell slots and additional spell slots overall.
new_spells_known: Prepare additional spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
When you successfully Turn Undead, undead of challenge rating 1 or lower are destroyed instead of turned.
You gain the 8th-level feature from your divine domain.
notes: The exact feature depends on your chosen domain.

short_rules: You gain access to 5th-level spell slots and additional spell slots overall.
new_spells_known: Prepare additional spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: Once per long rest, you can call upon your deity to intervene; success is based on your cleric level.
notes: On success, the DM chooses the nature of the intervention; see cleric rules for chance and limits.

short_rules: When you successfully Turn Undead, undead of challenge rating 2 or lower are destroyed instead of turned.
You gain access to 6th-level spell slots and additional spell slots overall.
new_spells_known: Prepare additional spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
You gain access to 7th-level spell slots and additional spell slots overall.
new_spells_known: Prepare additional spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: When you successfully Turn Undead, undead of challenge rating 3 or lower are destroyed instead of turned.
You gain access to 8th-level spell slots and additional spell slots overall.
new_spells_known: Prepare additional spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
When you successfully Turn Undead, undead of challenge rating 4 or lower are destroyed instead of turned.
You gain the 17th-level feature from your divine domain.
notes: The exact feature depends on your chosen domain.

short_rules: You gain access to 9th-level spell slots and additional spell slots overall.
new_spells_known: Prepare additional spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by +2 or two scores by +1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
When you use Divine Intervention, it automatically succeeds; no roll required.
notes: You no longer need to roll to determine whether your deity intervenes.

short_rules: You know the secret druidic language and can leave hidden messages that only other druids can decode.
You cast druid spells using Wisdom and start with several cantrips and 1st-level spells prepared.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Gain 1st-level spell slots; see druid spellcasting table.
new_spells_known: You prepare druid spells each day based on your level and Wisdom.
notes: Exact slots and preparation rules follow the druid spellcasting table.

short_rules: As an action you can magically assume the shape of a beast you have seen, a limited number of times per rest with restrictions based on challenge rating and movement modes.
notes: Initially limited to low-CR beasts without flying or swimming; improves at higher levels.

short_rules: Choose a druid circle that reflects your approach to nature; it grants additional features at higher levels.
notes: Refer to your chosen circle for its specific features.

short_rules: Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 2nd-level spell slots and more total slots.
new_spells_known: You can prepare additional druid spells as your level and Wisdom increase.
notes: See druid spellcasting table for exact slots.

short_rules: You can now transform into beasts of up to challenge rating 1/2 that lack a flying speed.
notes: Swimming movement becomes available at this tier if your table follows PHB guidance.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 3rd-level spell slots and more total slots.
new_spells_known: You can prepare additional druid spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: You gain the 6th-level feature from your chosen druid circle.
notes: Details depend on which circle you selected.

short_rules: Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 4th-level spell slots and more total slots.
new_spells_known: You can prepare additional druid spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: You can now transform into beasts of up to challenge rating 1, including creatures with a flying speed.
notes: This represents reaching the peak of normal beast forms.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 5th-level spell slots and more total slots.
new_spells_known: You can prepare additional druid spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: You gain the 10th-level feature from your chosen druid circle.
notes: Details depend on which circle you selected.

short_rules: Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 6th-level spell slots and more total slots.
new_spells_known: You can prepare additional druid spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 7th-level spell slots and more total slots.
new_spells_known: You can prepare additional druid spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: You gain the 14th-level feature from your chosen druid circle.
notes: Details depend on which circle you selected.

short_rules: Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 8th-level spell slots and more total slots.
new_spells_known: You can prepare additional druid spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 9th-level spell slots and more total slots.
new_spells_known: You can prepare additional druid spells as your level and Wisdom increase.

short_rules: Your body ages far more slowly; for every decade that passes your body only shows the effects of a year of aging.
notes: This is mostly narrative but can matter in long-running campaigns.

short_rules: You can now cast many of your druid spells while using Wild Shape, provided the spell has no material components or those components are built into your form.
notes: You still follow normal spellcasting limits and concentration rules.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
You can use Wild Shape an unlimited number of times and ignore many material components for your druid spells that lack a gold cost.
notes: Represents your full attunement to nature and its magic.

short_rules: Choose a combat style that grants a small but constant bonus to a particular way of fighting such as archery, defense, dueling, or two-weapon combat.
You can use a bonus action to catch your breath and regain a small amount of hit points once per short or long rest.
You can briefly push yourself beyond normal limits, taking one additional action on your turn a limited number of times between rests.
Choose a martial archetype that defines your fighting approach; it grants additional features at higher levels.
notes: Examples include champions, tactical masters, and magical knights.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat if your campaign uses feats.
When you take the Attack action on your turn you can make two weapon attacks instead of one.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You gain the 7th-level feature from your chosen martial archetype.
notes: Not every archetype uses this exact level in official material, but this slot is reserved for subclass growth.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You can reroll a failed saving throw using your fighting spirit, but must use the new result.
notes: You gain additional uses at higher levels.

short_rules: You gain the 10th-level feature from your chosen martial archetype.
When you take the Attack action on your turn you can make three weapon attacks instead of one.
notes: This improves the Extra Attack feature from 5th level.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You can now use your Indomitable feature twice between long rests.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You gain the 15th-level feature from your chosen martial archetype.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You can now use Action Surge twice between short or long rests.
You gain the 18th-level feature from your chosen martial archetype if it provides one.
notes: Some archetypes may not offer a feature at this level.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You can now use your Indomitable feature three times between long rests.
You master unarmed combat and simple monk weapons, using Dexterity for attacks and dealing improved martial arts damage while unarmored and unshielded.
Your training lets you rely on agility and focus for protection, giving you an AC based on Dexterity and Wisdom when not wearing armor or using a shield.
You gain a pool of ki points you can spend on special techniques like flurries of strikes, sudden dashes, or brief defensive stances.
notes: Covers Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, Step of the Wind-style options.

short_rules: Your speed increases while you fight unarmored, improving further as you level.
You choose a monastic path, gaining features that shape your combat style and mystical techniques.
You can use your reaction to reduce the damage from a ranged weapon attack, sometimes catching and returning the projectile.
Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
You can use your reaction to reduce fall damage by a large amount thanks to your training.
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make two attacks instead of one.
You can channel ki through your blows, forcing a creature you hit to save or be stunned for a short time.
Your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks.
You gain the 6th-level feature from your chosen monastic tradition.
You can nimbly dodge out of area effects, taking little or no damage on successful saves.
You can use an action to end an effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.
Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your mobility reaches supernatural levels; while unarmored you can briefly run up walls or across liquid surfaces.
Your ki sustains you, making you immune to disease and the effects of poison.
You gain the 11th-level feature from your chosen monastic tradition.
Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Through ki and meditation you can understand all spoken languages, and most creatures can understand you when you speak.
Your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws and the ability to reroll failed saves by spending ki.
Your ki slows your aging and reduces the need for food, drink, and rest.
Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
You gain the 17th-level feature from your chosen monastic tradition.
You can spend ki to become briefly invisible and resistant to many forms of damage, or even project your spirit to other planes.
Increase one ability by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
When you enter a fight with little ki remaining, your mastery restores some of it, ensuring you always have energy for key techniques.
You can open your awareness to detect strong evil or good a limited number of times per long rest, sensing such presences nearby.
You hold a pool of healing that replenishes on a long rest; as an action, you can restore hit points or cure certain conditions by spending points from this pool.
Choose a combat style that grants a steady bonus such as improved defense, archery, or two-weapon fighting.
You learn to cast paladin spells using Charisma, gaining access to 1st-level spell slots.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Gain 1st-level paladin spell slots; see paladin spellcasting table.
new_spells_known: You prepare paladin spells each day based on level and Charisma.

short_rules: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot to deal radiant damage in addition to the weapon's damage.
notes: Damage scales with spell slot level; especially potent against undead and fiends.

short_rules: Your faith shields your body, making you immune to disease.
You swear a sacred oath that shapes your paladin magic and behavior, granting oath-specific features and spells.
notes: Choose an oath such as Devotion, Ancients, or Vengeance.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make two melee weapon attacks instead of one.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 2nd-level spell slots and more total slots.
You and friendly creatures close to you add your Charisma modifier to saving throws while you are conscious.
notes: Aura radius increases at higher levels in some variants.

short_rules: You gain the 7th-level feature from your chosen sacred oath.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 3rd-level spell slots and more total slots.
You and friendly creatures close to you cannot be frightened while you are conscious.
Your weapon strikes are so suffused with radiant power that they deal extra radiant damage on every hit.
notes: Stacks with Divine Smite when you expend spell slots.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 4th-level spell slots and more total slots.
You can end certain spells or similar effects on yourself or others by touching the creature a limited number of times per long rest.
notes: Functions like a built-in dispel against spells on a creature.

short_rules: You gain the 15th-level feature from your chosen sacred oath.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 5th-level spell slots and more total slots.
The radius of your protective and courage auras expands, allowing you to shield more allies.
notes: Uses the same auras you gained earlier, but at a greater radius.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You gain the 20th-level capstone feature from your chosen sacred oath.
notes: Often a powerful transformation or aura that represents your perfect devotion.

short_rules: You choose types of creatures or a specific foe you excel at hunting, gaining bonuses to track them and recall information about them.
You are especially adept in a chosen type of terrain, gaining benefits to navigation, foraging, and certain checks while traveling there.
Choose a combat style such as archery, defense, or two-weapon fighting that grants a small but steady bonus.
You learn to cast ranger spells using Wisdom, gaining access to 1st-level spell slots.
new_spells_known: You know a limited number of ranger spells as shown on the ranger table.

short_rules: Your spellcasting begins with a small pool of 1st-level ranger slots.
Choose an archetype that reflects your hunting style, such as a relentless stalker, beast master, or deep wanderer.
You can expend a spell slot to sense the presence of certain creature types in a region around you, though not their exact location.
notes: Useful for foreshadowing powerful foes.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make two weapon attacks instead of one.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 2nd-level ranger spell slots.
You can choose additional or more specialized favored enemies, strengthening your hunting focus.
notes: Exact structure depends on whether you use classic favored enemy or a variant.

short_rules: You gain the 7th-level feature from your chosen ranger archetype.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement, and you resist being slowed by plants.
notes: Also grants advantages versus some plant-based magic.

short_rules: Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 3rd-level ranger spell slots.
You can spend time to carefully camouflage yourself, making it much harder for others to detect you while you remain still.
notes: Modeled as a large bonus to Stealth checks while you stay motionless.

short_rules: You gain the 11th-level feature from your chosen ranger archetype.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 4th-level ranger spell slots.
You can use Hide as a bonus action on your turn and are harder to track when you choose to leave no trail.
notes: Synergizes strongly with stealth-focused builds.

short_rules: You gain the 15th-level feature from your chosen ranger archetype.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 5th-level ranger spell slots.
Your senses are so sharp that you can effectively perceive creatures that are invisible or hidden within a short range.
notes: Represents a kind of limited blindsense based on keen instincts.

short_rules: You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
Your connection to your prey reaches its peak; once per turn you can add your Wisdom modifier to an attack roll or damage roll against one of your favored enemies.
notes: A capstone that keeps your favored enemy relevant at all tiers of play.

short_rules: Once per turn you can deal extra damage when you hit a creature with an attack and meet the conditions for catching it off guard.
notes: Extra damage die increases at many later levels.

short_rules: Choose two of your skill or tool proficiencies; your proficiency bonus is doubled for them.
You know a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and ciphers that allows you to hide messages in ordinary conversation.
You can use a bonus action each turn in combat to Dash, Disengage, or Hide.
Choose a roguish archetype that focuses your talents such as thief, assassin, or arcane trickster.
Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 2d6.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
When an attacker you can see hits you with an attack you can use your reaction to halve the damage.
Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 3d6.
You can choose two more of your proficiencies to gain the benefits of Expertise.
When you make a Dexterity saving throw against an effect that allows half damage on a success, you instead take no damage on a success and only half on a failure.
Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 4d6.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You gain the 9th-level feature from your chosen roguish archetype.
Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 5d6.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
When you make an ability check that adds your proficiency bonus, a very low d20 roll is treated as a solid result instead.
notes: Commonly implemented by treating rolls below a certain threshold as that threshold.

short_rules: Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 6d6.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You gain the 13th-level feature from your chosen roguish archetype.
Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 7d6.
You gain a limited radius within which you can sense hidden or invisible creatures as long as you can hear.
Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 8d6.
Your mental defenses improve, granting you proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.
Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 9d6.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
You gain the 17th-level feature from your chosen roguish archetype.
Your Sneak Attack damage increases to 10d6.
Your experience makes you extremely hard to pin down; while you are not incapacitated, no attack roll against you has advantage.
You can raise one ability score by 2 or two different scores by 1, or take a feat.
Once per short rest you can turn a crucial failure into success, either making a missed attack hit or treating a failed ability check as if you had rolled very high.
You cast sorcerer spells using Charisma, knowing a small set of spells that you can cast with your spell slots.
new_spells_known: Learn several 1st-level sorcerer spells from the class list.
notes: Use the sorcerer spellcasting table for exact slots and spells known.

short_rules: You choose the magical source of your power, such as a draconic bloodline or wild magic surge.
You gain sorcery points that you can spend to create extra spell slots or convert slots back into sorcery points.
You learn techniques to twist your spells, such as extending duration, doubling targets, or casting more subtly.
notes: You learn more metamagic options at higher levels.

short_rules: Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 2nd-level sorcerer spell slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 3rd-level sorcerer spell slots.
You gain the 6th-level feature from your chosen sorcerous origin.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 4th-level sorcerer spell slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 5th-level sorcerer spell slots.
You learn another metamagic option, broadening the ways you can modify your spells.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 6th-level sorcerer spell slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 7th-level sorcerer spell slots.
You gain the 14th-level feature from your chosen sorcerous origin.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 8th-level sorcerer spell slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 9th-level sorcerer spell slots.
You gain the 18th-level feature from your chosen sorcerous origin.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
You regain a few expended sorcery points each time you finish a short rest.
You form a pact with a powerful being such as a fiend, archfey, or alien entity, gaining origin-themed features at later levels.
You gain a small number of spell slots that all use the same level and refresh on a short rest instead of a long rest.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Gain 1st-level pact slots; see warlock spellcasting table.
new_spells_known: Learn several 1st-level warlock spells from the class list.
notes: Pact slots increase in level over time but never exceed 5th level.

short_rules: You learn special invocations that grant at-will abilities, passive bonuses, or extra spells, fueled by your pact.
notes: You learn more invocations as you level and can swap some when you gain a level.

short_rules: You choose a boon such as a pact weapon, familiar, or grimoire, tailoring how your patron's power manifests.
notes: Represents Pact of the Blade, Chain, or Tome-style options.

short_rules: Your pact slots increase in level and number as shown on the warlock table.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Pact slots become 2nd-level at this tier.
new_spells_known: Gain an additional warlock spell known.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your pact slots become higher level and you know more spells.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Pact slots become 3rd-level at this tier.
new_spells_known: Gain an additional warlock spell known.

short_rules: You gain the 6th-level feature from your chosen patron.
Your pact slots upgrade again, and you know more spells.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Pact slots become 4th-level at this tier.
new_spells_known: Gain an additional warlock spell known.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your pact slots reach their maximum level, and you know more spells.
new_spell_slot_tiers: Pact slots become 5th-level and remain that way from now on.
new_spells_known: Gain an additional warlock spell known.

short_rules: You gain the 10th-level feature from your chosen patron.
You gain a special high-level spell you can cast once per long rest without using your pact slots.
notes: You choose a 6th-level warlock spell as your first mystic arcanum.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
You gain a 7th-level warlock spell that you can cast once per long rest without using pact slots.
notes: Each arcanum is a fixed spell choice unless your DM allows retraining.

short_rules: You gain the 14th-level feature from your chosen patron.
You gain an 8th-level warlock spell that you can cast once per long rest without using pact slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
You gain a 9th-level warlock spell that you can cast once per long rest without using pact slots.
Your connection to your patron deepens, preparing you for the ability to quickly restore your magic.
notes: This row exists mainly to reflect the progression; the main benefit is at 20th level.

short_rules: Increase one ability score by 2 or two abilities by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
You can briefly commune with your patron to instantly regain all expended pact magic slots once per long rest.
You prepare and cast wizard spells using Intelligence, starting with cantrips and 1st-level spell slots.
new_spells_known: Start with several 1st-level wizard spells in your spellbook.
notes: Use the wizard spellcasting table for exact slots and preparation counts.

short_rules: Once per day after a short rest, you recover some expended spell slots.
Choose a school of magic to specialize in; it grants features at higher levels.
Your spellcasting advances, granting more 1st-level slots and access to 2nd-level spell slots.
new_spells_known: You add more spells to your spellbook as you level.

short_rules: You gain additional spell slots, including more 2nd-level slots and your first 3rd-level slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, increasing your number of spell slots and granting 3rd-level spell slots in greater quantity.
You gain the 6th-level feature from your chosen school of magic.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 4th-level spell slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 5th-level spell slots.
You gain the 10th-level feature from your chosen school of magic.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 6th-level spell slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 7th-level spell slots.
You gain the 14th-level feature from your chosen school of magic.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 8th-level spell slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
Your spellcasting advances, granting access to 9th-level spell slots.
You choose low-level wizard spells that you can cast at will without expending spell slots.
Increase one ability score by 2 or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat if allowed.
You choose a couple of 3rd-level spells as your signature spells; you always have them prepared and can cast them once each without using a spell slot.
